basics.name: Michal Lewkowicz
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Undergraduate researcher specializing in robotics, artificial intelligence, and human-robot interaction.

work.name: Yale Social Robotics Lab
highlights: Co-led project investigating strategy estimation for multiple agents in competitive and collaborative settings.

Built a real-time object interception algorithm on a Stretch RE1 robot for sorting objects with human preferences and worked on a semi-supervised clustering algorithm for identifying sub-categorizations of recyclables.

Utilized ROS, OpenCV, and Speech-to-Text to build the software infrastructure of an in-home interruptions training social robot for adults with ASD on the Jibo robot platform. Conducted a user study in ~15 homes.
Implemented Bayesian knowledge tracing for tracking the knowledge of an intelligent robotic tutoring system using a UR5e robot arm.

work.name: Yale Interactive Machines Group
highlights: Led the development of a Unity-ROS simulator for multi-agent reinforcement learning and social navigation.
Enabled fine-grained control of simulated pedestrians and agents, and sensor emulation for sim-to-real transfer.

work.name: KAIST Interaction Lab (KIXLAB)
highlights: Built the pipeline for a multi-modal video editing system to enable the expression of edits with natural language and sketching (integrated CLIP, activity recognition, dense captioning, and LLMs to reason about video context).

work.name: Yale LILY Lab & Meta AI
highlights: Investigated fusion of semantic representation graphs (AMR) for improving faithfulness of abstractive text summarization in collaboration with Facebook's Language and Translation Technologies (LATTE) group.

work.name: Interacting Robotic Systems Lab at Stony Brook
highlights: Used graph-based techniques to design a novel leader selection algorithm for distributed robotic swarm control and worked on optimizing path planning algorithms.

work.name: Concepts for Adaptive Learning (CfAL)
highlights: Provided computer and technology training to students and adults around New Haven (full-stack development).
Ran community outreach programs such as a virtual computer lab, programming workshops, and personalized tutoring.
